Wavemaker Partners is Southeast Asia’s leading early-stage venture capital firm investing in enterprise and deep tech companies.

About Smartkarma

Smartkarma is a global investment network that brings together independent Insight Providers, institutional investors, and corporate investor relations professionals and management. Smartkarma reinvents Equity and Credit Research by providing differentiated, independent analysis on companies, markets, and industries across the world. This includes areas under-reported by mainstream market coverage, including Event-Driven, IPOs & placements, and small/mid-cap equities. Smartkarma’s online platform enables corporate and buy-side clients to streamline their communication and data reporting, and allows them to set their own real-time alerts, customise their reading lists, directly contact Insight Providers, and remain MiFID II-compliant as unbundling regulations change the investment research industry.
The Singapore-headquartered company expanded quickly since its launch in late 2014, with offices in London, New York, and Frankfurt. Smartkarma recently secured a strategic partnership and investment from Singapore Exchange (SGX). Our Series B funding round was led by Sequoia Capital and supported by our roster of high profile institutions in the region including Wavemaker Partners, Jungle Investors, and SPRING Singapore.

Smartkarma Insight Providers have been featured in Reuters, Bloomberg, Nikkei, the Financial Times, and a number of influential business publications.

Business Development at Smartkarma

The Business Development team drives revenue growth at the company through new customer acquisition and building and maintaining relationships with clients and partners.

Smartkarma is seeking a motivated and energetic Account Manager to join the Singapore headquarters. We are looking for someone who can build long term relationships with clients and identify areas in which Smartkarma can help provide solutions to these clients.

Roles & Responsibilities
We seek a business analyst to join Smartkarma’s Research team, which is responsible for all aspects of the company’s independent investment research offering from Insight Provider onboarding to engagement of research. You will be responsible for operations within the team such as monitoring operational metrics of projects, recommending improvements and finalising reporting to the Finance team.
Job Responsibilities
Coordinate and handle reporting to Finance team for monthly payment cycle for Insight Providers
Develop a deep understanding of the independent research landscape and of the Smartkarma platform
Track and monitor performance of Research team OKRs
Assist the team with recruiting Insight Providers, driving research engagement and managing Insight Provider relationships
Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in Business Management, Economics, Computer Science, or equivalent work experience
Demonstrated interest in Finance and Financial Markets
SQL experience strongly preferred
Detail oriented, analytical and inquisitive
Ability to work independently and with others
Extremely organized with strong time-management skills

Job Title: Junior to Mid Level Legal Consultant – Technology
Job Description:
Is there a different way to practice law? We certainly think so.

Established 19 years ago, Axiom is the world’s leading alternative legal services provider. With over 2,000 employees in 16 locations, we provide legal services to the world’s best-known corporate and financial services institutions. Our consultants are commercially astute specialists in their field who enjoy a rare combination of high quality work and the unprecedented ability to choose the clients for whom they want to work.

Why join Axiom?
Access to top-tier, in-house legal teams, and the opportunity to become an integral part of their in-house legal function, working on a broad range of interesting and challenging assignments.
Retain control over your career path, with the flexibility to take time off between engagements while retaining your employee benefits.
Bespoke career guidance and support, plus access to resources to enhance your professional and personal development. This includes free access to a series of executive management training courses centred around the business of law and focused on providing you with genuine in-house business skills.
You are matched with appropriate opportunities by our dedicated Lawyer Talent Team, who will talk you through specific client instructions on a case-by-case basis. Their goal is to find you engagements which most closely match your skill set and stated career objectives.
Access to a full suite of employee benefits, including CPF contribution, paid time off and private healthcare.
What makes an Axiom consultant?
Good academic credentials and post-qualification experience.
In-house legal experience is preferred (directly, or as a secondee) but is not essential.
Strong commercial understanding, and excellent interpersonal skills.
Desire to provide excellent client service and an ability to build strong working relationships with stakeholders.
The ability to adapt to new situations and work environments, and a thirst for new challenges.
Read our FAQs to learn more about what it’s like to be an Axiom consultant.

What are we looking for?

We are actively recruiting for Legal Consultants with Technology experience to join our ranks with:

Ideally, a minimum of 2 years’ PQE advising on a wide spectrum of IT related legal matters (including e-commerce, Cloud, FinTech and other technology product and services) gained either within private practice or in-house role(s). Exposure to investigations, compliance and regulations will be advantageous.

The responsibilities for this role will include:
Working side by side with the legal and business teams of our F500 clients to help internal stakeholders meet company goals.
Providing practical legal advice and support on business matters in a dynamic environment
Drafting, reviewing, negotiating and advising on a variety of transactions such as inbound / outbound licensing agreements, software development contracts, services and consulting agreements, IT and business process outsourcing agreements, and SaaS agreements etc.
Advising on legal issues associated with the development, implementation and use of technology products in connection with the company’ products and services.
Contact us in complete confidence to find out more about opportunities to work with Axiom as an employee.

Axiom is an equal opportunity employer and committed to a diverse workforce.

Axiom Global Solutions Pte. Ltd. (Axiom SG) is a registered employment agency (License #12S5884). Axiom as a corporate entity, does not offer legal advice, and is not a registered foreign law firm.

Apply

Drive product developer to enable impactful digital transformation
The bridge between business and technology in a highly collaborative environment
Immerse in the e-commerce domain in a transparent and responsive organisation
An exclusive IT digital transformation partner. A highly collaborative and agile environment - You get the chance to be part of a vastly passionate and warm team. You'll be kicking off custom-built products from scratch, champion to set the stage in becoming the driver to change.

Key challenges for the scope:
Drive product development
Establish yourself as the main bridge between business and IT
Enabling digital transformation by creating technical solutions and integration with development teams
Balance is key, do you have what it takes to challenge your peers and stakeholders?

Believes in agility and eager to learn and apply DevOps
A huge fan of the E-commerce industry
A strong and targeted communicator

Job Purpose/Role

This role will be part of highly dynamic and collaborative team in establishing a new digital insurance company. You will be key in leading, developing and documenting the detailed requirements and formation of various components of the digital products and supporting operational processes.
We are a new digital insurance operation, and as such, the opportunity to for you to provide advisory and expert guidance will be highly desired. Your role will grow with the business.

Lead the gathering, development and documentation of business requirements for the purpose of technology/system development and digital operational process development.
Use your experience to derive and drive the design of the functionality and operational processes. These will form the key artefact inputs to system development and new technology enablement.

Act as the interface between the business lines and the technical/operational development teams. This role will also act as a Product Owner capacity when required as part of the DevOps approach.
Manage and monitor the developments until delivery

Proven track record of delivery.

Excellent cross-team collaboration, with a demonstrated ability to work across stakeholder groups, functional areas, geographies, and differing levels of seniority to get things done.

Business Analysis

Job Description & Summary

Our work focus on delivering business led, technology enabled change for our clients including industry specific ERP applications and the latest in cloud solutions. We respond to industry trends and management focus, and we combine our deep technical skills in response to our clients' changing needs. Our aim is to support our clients in designing, managing and executing lasting beneficial change.

A career in our Enterprise Applications & Cloud (EAC) practice will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients maximise the value of their SAP investment with offerings that address sales, finance, supply chain and human capital. We provide comprehensive consulting, system integration and implementation services across multiple SAP applications, products and technologies.

Your Key Responsibilities:
Effectively contribute in business process improvement and ERP (SAP S/4HANA) enablement initiatives
Conduct business needs analysis and identify key business challenges with the client teams and key stakeholders.
Identify improvement opportunities to achieve clients’ desired business outcomes.
Define ‘To-Be’ stage of processes, solution application requirement and performance measurements.
Assist and perform deployment activities and measure achievement of desired outcomes.
Involve in change for large scale multi-site ERP Implementation (SAP S/4HANA), and other related transformational change efforts, including but not limited to efficiency and effectiveness initiatives; organizational restructurings; organizational capabilities development.
Support pursuit team with gaining access to tenders, build proposals, win work and deliver projects.

A recognized Bachelor Degree qualification.
Minimum 3-5 years and above of relevant experience in SAP S/4HANA Transformation, or similar capacity in Advisory or Technology Consulting workspace.
Demonstrates extensive abilities as independent consultant/workstream lead with proficient knowledge and understanding of SAP S/4HANA Finance application-based solutions.
Demonstrates in-depth level of extensive abilities and success with identifying and addressing client needs by building, maintaining, and utilizing networks of client relationships and community involvement; communicating value propositions; and, preparing and/or coordinating complex written and verbal materials.
Ability to develop, implement and support complex business processes in an SAP environment; to design, build, test and deploy S/4HANA Finance business and technical solutions, emphasizing RICEFWs
Strong in problem solving skills and able to understand how business processes work and integrate in multiple technology platforms environment.
Ability to demonstrate abilities and/or a proven record of success as a deputy lead/team leader.
Foster team collaboration within workstream and across functional/technical teams.
Flexibility to travel in the region when required.

Job Title: Associate/Consultant/Senior Consultant, Tax Technology and Transformation, APTC
Job Description:
Our Tax
Technology and Transformation practice provides a wide range of services around
various tax operational challenges that our clients face with respect to
technology, data, process and people. As part of a global team of tax and
technology professionals in 150 countries, you will get plenty of opportunities
to use and build upon your experience in strategy and process consulting, data
management, implementation of tax software systems and designing and building
tax requirements for various systems to help our clients improve the
performance of tax functions.

The
opportunity

As a member of
the Tax Technology & Transformation practice, you’ll create exciting
solutions and support the team in building and maintaining relationships with
clients. You will be involved in key projects to assist our clients to optimise
performance of their functions.

Your key responsibilities
Evaluate and optimize tax function: By assessing current state, benchmarking with leading practice, providing optimization solution options, etc.
Process and Controls Enhancement: Re-design and deploy streamlined tax processes including new technology solutions to standardized work processes, embed proper controls and manage risks
Intelligent Automation: automate tax processing, tax compliance and reporting through various tax technologies such as robotics and machine learning
Data Management and Data Quality improvement
Skills and attributes for success
A keen interest and experience in improving the performance of tax functions
Comfortable with picking up technology processes and software
Demonstrated ability to team with and motivate others
Willingness to develop meaningful and influential relationships with clients and colleagues
Strong attention to detail, problem-solving skills
To qualify for the role you must have
A degree in Business, Computer Science or Information Systems
At least 1 -2 year (Associate), 3 years (Consultant position), 5 years (Senior Consultant) of relevant work experience
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Outgoing and proactive personality
Ideally, you'll also have
Experience in one or more of the following areas:
Accounting and finance
Development and/or implementation of tax technology solution
Finance or tax performance improvement experience
Knowledge and experience in RPA software (e.g., Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere, UiPath)
Knowledge and experience in business intelligence software (e.g., Tableau, Alteryx, Qlik)
Good object-oriented design and coding skills in C#, VBA
Experience and good working knowledge in the following areas:
.Net Framework
Development of front-end web pages - html, css, javascript, jquery, and common framework as bootstrap etc.
MS SharePoint
MS SQL Server - SQL, triggers, functions, stored procedures, the preparation of capacity.
Computer science fundamentals
Software engineering, project management knowledge and experience
C/S and B/S model development
Experience working in public accounting firms and accreditation by SIATP
What we look for

Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.
What working at EY offers

EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:
Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
About EY

Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers and partners use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster and at lower cost? Do you have a background in enterprise call centers, and a passion for driving innovation into existing IT organizations? Are you comfortable working on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high-impact projects blending the newest technology with existing operational methodologies and tooling? Are you passionate about helping customers solve the people, organizational and process issues preventing them realizing the benefits of cloud?

At AWS, were hiring experienced consultants with a background in enterprise call centers to help our enterprise customers understand, plan and implement best practices around migrating, managing and operating Amazon Connect within their AWS cloud environments. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, re-usable artifacts, reference architectures, and lead implementation projects to assist some of the worlds leading enterprises transform their call centers to Amazon Connect and the AWS platform.

Were looking for someone who is passionate about:
· Working on the cutting edge of innovative AWS products and services
· Maintaining domain knowledge and expertise in enterprise call centers, workforce management, and CRM platforms
· Implementing and extending frameworks and methodologies commonly used by enterprises to assess, migrate, and transform the call center experience
· Architecting large-scale solutions, which integrate smoothly in hybrid operating models for supporting Amazon Connect
· Providing guidance on the people and organizational aspects of transforming the call center to the Cloud
· Setting-up and configuring AWS services in-line with best practices
· Coaching customers and partner teams to be self-sufficient
Responsibilities include:
· Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn how to build and move to production grade AWS environments that support Amazon Connect
· Solutions - Define and deliver on-site Professional Services engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, proposing and delivering packaged offerings, and delivering custom solution engagements, specifically focused on call center organization, processes, tooling and integration.
· Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects proving the use of AWS services to support new distributed computing solutions that often span private cloud and public cloud services. Engagements will include integration and adaption of existing enterprise call centers into Amazon Connect.
· Insights - Work with AWS product, engineering and support teams to convey partner and customer needs and feedback as input to technology roadmaps. Share real world implementation challenges and recommend new capabilities that would simplify adoption and drive greater value from use of AWS cloud services. Contribute to best practice in the form of whitepapers and playbooks.
· Partnering Work with new vendors to help them become MSPs and enable and upskill existing partners.



Basic Qualifications


Basic Qualification
· BS level degree; Computer Science or Engineering background preferred; Masters degree desired
· 10+ years of experience as an enterprise IT Architect in customer-facing roles
· Responsibility for designing, implementing and operating call centers or telecommunication infrastructures within enterprise environment.
· Hands-on technical practitioner and individual contributor
· Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
· Ability to be mobile and available for international assignments
· Highly analytical, possessing significant enterprise call center / telecomm implementation and operations experience
· Deep hands-on experience working on the design, development and deployment of enterprise supporting systems at scale



Preferred Qualifications

Preferred Qualification
· 10+ years of experience building call center / collaboration / telephony platforms in a Cloud or On-Premises environment, particularly building application integration capabilities for CRM/ WFM platforms
· Familiarity with Amazon Connect capabilities, benefits, and required deployment skills
· Visible IT Industry thought leadership on relevant topics related to enterprise IT call centers and infrastructure
· Serverless development experience including complex integrations with Lambda, Redshift, Aurora, Kinesis and Dynamo DB.
· Use of AWS services in distributed environments with Microsoft, IBM, Citrix, VMware, Oracle, HP, etc.

Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities

AvePoint is the Microsoft Cloud expert. Over 15,000 companies and 6 million cloud users worldwide trust AvePoint to migrate, manage, and protect their Office 365 and SharePoint data. AvePoint’s integrated cloud, hybrid, and on-premises software solutions are enhanced by 24/7 support and award-winning services. Organizations across six continents and all industries rely on AvePoint to ease transition to the Microsoft Cloud, increase IT administrator productivity, and satisfy governance and compliance objectives.

AvePoint is seeking a Business Analyst with enterprise software solutions experience to join us in our Client Services division. The Business Analyst analyzes business processes and applicable automated systems, and develops As-Is and To-Be descriptions. This individual leads requirements gathering and analysis activities, prepares and delivers written and oral communications, participates in testing activities, helps design methods and procedures for internal and external projects.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Elicit requirements for software development using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analyses.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into detail, identify risks, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Translate technical information into business language to ensure understanding of the requirements by both technical and non-technical audiences.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Functional requirements (Business Requirements Document), Use Cases, GUI, Screen and Interface designs.
Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.
Operate as the liaison between the business units, technology teams, and support teams.
Support the project manager and other team members in planning deliverables, scope, schedule, and other aspects of the project
Supervise at least two junior team members, including conducting interviews, making hiring recommendations, conducting regular 1-on-1 meetings, drafting IDPs, and completing performance evaluations.

3 years SharePoint experience at least;
product manager experience
SharePoint maintenance experience;
SharePoint portal project experience;
computing or software relevant bachelor degree
Understanding of Microsoft SharePoint architecture, components, and configuration
Understands Internet, Intranet, Extranet and client/server architectures
Professional experience with analyzing and documenting complex business processes, software development requirements, and taxonomies.
Professional experience with requirements gathering and analysis.
Experience producing and analyzing As-Is and To-Be documentation.
Experience preparing and delivering written and oral communications.
Strong analytical and project management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Familiarity with MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Powerpoint).
Ability to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Experience supervising junior associates, including conducting interviews, making hire recommendations, and completing performance reviews.

Title: Business Analyst Location: Singapore Salary: Competitive market rate Duration: 1 year contract

For an Agile Deliveries, the Business Analyst is responsible to work closely with the product owner to help for maximising the business value of the product resulting from work done by the Development Team. The BA is the person who supports and backs up the Product Owner for the successful delivery which includes all aspects of the data relating to their Agile Delivery

The BA role is usually assigned to the Product Owner who has operational/business responsibility for the Product. This ensures that business requirements are adequately addressed and converted into technical user stories and clarifies dependencies for project delivery.

Responsibilities

Detailing the Product Backlog requirements and user stories, especially detailing the acceptance criteria and technical analysis to support PO to create and maintain a quality Product Backlog
Providing download for detailed requirements to the respective stakeholders and walking them through the details.
Supporting Product Owner while creating and maintaining a prioritised Product Backlog, ensuring it is visible, transparent and clear
Supporting the Product Owner for preparing the Agile Execution Document, including the Initial Release Plan and other associated mandatory milestones and tracking and reporting delivery against the Initial Release Plan
Ensuring the Agile Delivery Team members understand items in the Product Backlog to the level needed
Joining the technical analysis with respective development teams to translate business requirements into details for them to help sizing and solutioning exercises.
Ensuring Project deliverables are of the desired quality and have appropriate endorsements/ sign-offs
Support the Product Owner for transitioning and hand over to BAU.
This role provides a rare opportunity for anyone who wants to be part of the project of a global bank to work on their digital banking transformation.
The person will be working on initiatives on payment, onboarding etc as this project works on covering all areas. BA will have a holistic view on how we shape digital banking from scratch

Requirements

Experience in Digital Banking Initiatives, especially on Mobile Banking, Online Banking, Wearables, or any other digital channels or devices
Understanding the Customer Experience design and user experience principles.
Understanding the Agile delivery principles and basic knowledge about Scrum.
Having CSPP Certification is a plus.
Strong Communication Skills.
Strong Business acumen
Good understanding about digital developments and customer expectations from digital banking products and services.
Experience using tools such as Sharepoint, Jira, Confluence, etc.
Good understanding about Mobile Apps, mobile operating systems and digital banking / finance apps in the market

We are looking for talents who are passionate to be part of an exciting 3-year-old marketing, sales & service consultancy. He or she will have the opportunity to work closely with the Founder and VK Transformation's rockstars to expand the practice and help businesses to navigate through the complexities and uncertainties business environment. You will have the opportunity to take the lead for our Data Analytics Center of Excellence, he or she will be responsible to develop analytics capabilities for the firm, acquire relevant data, analyze multiple data sources and translate them into actionable business insights for our clients to improve sales & marketing performance.

What You Will Learn

The Business Analyst will experience exponential learning curve if he or she can thrive in a fast-paced and ambiguous nature of a consulting practice startup. There will be opportunities for him or her to work on different projects and enjoy the excitement of analytical problem-solving, critical thinking & innovation across Asia Pacific region.

Duties and Responsibilities
Work on product development for sales and marketing intelligence and digital transformation diagnostic tools.
Deep understanding of key high-value problems in sales and marketing performance for B2B and B2C and problem solve by applying data analytics.
Conduct data analysis on various aspects of our clients’ sales & marketing to help improve business metrics.
The analyses will cover advanced statistical concepts like multi-variate analysis, decision trees, random forest, statistical forecasting, data mining, recommendation systems, user behavior modeling etc. that will have a direct impact on sales and marketing metrics.
Work closely with the team to deliver advanced data-driven decision making for the business.
Develop analytical frameworks to capture new opportunities, improve sales productivity and business operations for our clients. Identify smart insight tools which could potentially help our clients.
Build analytical models or dashboards to track effective sales management. This model will also support the coaching conversation between sales/business leaders and sales professionals.
Document technical and functional specifications and proof of concept findings.
Build sales & marketing models and scenarios.
Conduct research and draw insights to review and develop business growth strategies for the firm and clients as well as improve their competitiveness in the market.
Perform data analysis, market & trend analysis, market sizing and competitive analysis as well as qualitative research in support of the different client projects.
Develop a market strategy and thought leadership to scale the firm’s practice in key selected regions for specific products.
Become the subject matter expert and facilitator for analytics in sales & marketing.
The successful candidate should possess the following qualification and qualities:
At least 2-3 years of business analytics experience with a Bachelor or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineer, Math, Economics (with Data Analytics) or any other relevant discipline.
Strong analytical aptitude (basic SQL, Excel, Power BI, Tableau Software and data visualization).
Regional experience in consulting firms is required.
Software programming using Python, SQL, VBA Macros or others is preferred.
Strong analytical thinking with experience in deriving business insights from data analytics.
Ability to communicate complex ideas and recommendations effectively (both verbally and in writing in English) to clients at all levels in an organization.
Strong appetite to work in a startup environment and comfortable with fast pace changes & ambiguous working environment.
Resourcefulness in exploring analytical tools to help clients to determine opportunity headroom.
Keep up to date with new technology trends which will help clients with digital transformation efforts especially for SMEs and large enterprises.
Strong appetite for quantitative problem-solving, bottom-line oriented thinking (problem sizing and impact), a thinker who can clarify, curious, understand and re-state business problems.
This is a non-exhaustive list of duties and can evolve with time.

Please kindly send your CV to info@vktransformation.com. Your interest will be treated with strict confidence.

Roles & Responsibilities

Responsibilities:
Independent work package and sub-project responsibility in (inter-)national customer projects
Development of innovative solutions and measures in the areas strategy, reorganization and operational excellence
Detection and analysis of complex interrelations and challenges as well as derivation of convincing concepts
Continuous extension and specialization of the competencies in the automotive industry and regarding future-oriented technologies
Contributions to the project success based on quality, efficiency, methodology and precise communication
Development of professional, high quality presentations
Self-confident behavior and independent acting in an interdisciplinary and international environment
Personal initiative and value creation in internal projects concerning the business development of Continental Business Consulting
Requirements:
University degree preferably in Business/Economics or (Industrial) Engineering

Job Title: Professional Services - Senior Big Data & Analytics Consultant
Job Description:
Are you an Big Data/Analytics specialist who can address the challenges of migrating systems and workloads to the public cloud? Are you skilled at helping customers and partners to address their Big Data/Analytics projects using cloud computing architectures? Do you want to learn the very latest in cloud web services technologies and apply them to some of the most interesting computing workloads in the world?
At AWS, were hiring highly technical Big Data/Analytics consultants to help our partners develop technical expertise and capacity, and to work with our partners on key customer engagements. Our Big Data/Analytics consultants will deliver architecture guidance, lead proof-of-concept projects, and conduct customer workshops. AWS consultants will collaborate with customers to address their Big Data/Analytics challenges, and implementing and migrating customer solutions and workloads onto AWS.


This role will specialize in all aspects of Big Data/Analytics using cloud web services in large scale computing environments.


Responsibilities include:
· Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3), Amazon SimpleDB/RDS databases, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), etc.
· Solutions - Define and deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer Big Data/Analytics requirements, and proposing and delivering packaged offerings, and delivering custom solution engagements.
· Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects proving the use of AWS services to support new distributed computing solutions that often span private cloud and public cloud services. Engagements will include migration of existing applications and development of new applications using AWS cloud services.
· Insights - Work with AWS engineering, support and business teams to convey partner and customer feedback as input to AWS technology roadmaps.
· Amazon aims to be the most customer centric company on earth. Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers critical applications for hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world.



Basic Qualifications

· 3+ years of experience in cloud
· 10+ years of experience with direct customer interaction
· 10+ years experience with Databases (SQL/NoSQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, MariaDB, PostgreSQL), Big Data open source tools (Hadoop, Spark), Big Data proprietary tools (Hortonworks, Claudera) programing experience (Python, R, Julia, Hive) BI tools (Tableau, Spotfire, Microstrategy, Cognos, etc).
· Business level command of English language, reading, writing and speaking.
· Extended travel to customer locations may be required to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Preferred Qualifications

· Current, large scale project implementation experience required; Internet-related business models preferred
· Strong verbal and written communications skills and ability to lead effectively across organizations
· Proven experience with key vertical markets like Financial Sector, Telecom, and Utilities.
· MBA preferred
· Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges
· Highly technical and analytical, possessing 7 or more years of IT implementation/consulting experience
· Implementation of AWS services in a distributed environments with Microsoft, IBM, Oracle, HP, SAP etc.
· BS level degree required, computer science, business or math background preferred.
· Deep understanding of cloud computing technologies and workload transition challenges

Ambition not only recruits on behalf of some exceptional companies but due to unprecedented growth, Ambition is also looking for talented individuals to join our fantastic recruitment business.

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government ICT

Infrastructure Services (“Services”) to Government agencies and their public officers through

empowering the public officers to self-help, acquire and use these Services more easily and

seamlessly, thereby improving their overall user experience of the Services.
integrates with a suite of back-end ICT infrastructure technologies for the delivery and support of
the Services. The goal is to deliver user-centric services with optimal user experience.

To achieve the above outcome, one of the critical success factors is to implement and continually enhance an enterprise service management platform (“ESMP”, powered by ServiceNow®)that integrates with a suite of back-end ICT infrastructure technologies for the delivery and support of the Services. The goal is to deliver user-centric services with optimal user experience.

As a Business Analyst, you will play an instrumental role in the design, development, testing and release of multiple applications on the ESMP that would continuously deliver good user and customer experience, and that can quickly react to changing business and stakeholder expectations. You will work closely with project managers, UX/UI designers, and front-end/back-end developers and product owners (or their representatives).

What to Expect:
Plan and conduct discovery sessions with product owners (or representatives) to identify, understand and document business requirements and their related personas
Assist and/or guide product owners (or representatives) to translate business requirements into user stories as inputs to the product backlog
Assist and/or guide product owners (or representatives) to refine the product backlog and prioritise product backlog items
Confirm “definition of done” and “acceptance criteria” with the product owners (or representatives)
Drive the design and development of the product backlog items, and define test cases for these items
Monitor the progress of the development and testing of the product backlog items and highlight any impact to scope, timelines and resources
Oversee the planning and execution of acceptance tests to ascertain that product backlog items are delivered as agreed, and ensure that all test results are documented.
Conduct relevant quality assurance review on the product backlog items that are developed
Be the first-point-of-contact after “go-live” to manage issues, identify areas of improvement and drive enhancements for the product backlog items that are released
Manage the resolution of issues and implementation of enhancements.
How to Succeed:
At least 2 years of working experience as a business analyst for service portals, workflows and/or IT service management systems
At least 3 years of working experience in enterprise ICT infrastructure services, in the capacity of a project manager, business analyst, implementation engineer, operations engineer, or any other similar role, is preferred
Strong communication skill (in English, both spoken and written), with the ability to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders
Good team player
Strong desire to acquire new skills and to work with new technologies

About Us


Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

Practice Area Profile

BCG’s Technology Advantage (TA) practice focuses on helping clients deliver competitive advantage and business superior performance through the use of data, technology and digital. TA is the fastest growing practice at BCG and at the heart of the strategic impact we have with our clients. Our consultants and experts globally work across all industries and provide deep experience and expertise across a number of topics including: * Digital Transformation * Data & Digital Platforms * Software & Agile * Digitizing the Tech Function

Role Profile

The Consultant is have an interest and ideally expertise in Leadership and Talent topics. He/ She will play a key role with case teams to deliver L&T projects. They will also support the core management team of LTEC in building out the centre.

With case teams, the Consultant will bring topic expertise based on personal experience and understanding of LTEC's tools, techniques and methodologies. They will support case teams to deliver L&T modules on cases. They will have a direct client facing role and where needed will be expected to lead meetings with clients in different contexts. They will work with both LTEC managers and case team members in delivering this role. LTEC Consultants will spend 50-75% of their time on client facing projects.

Consultants will also play a role in supporting the management team to build out of the centre. This includes developing new offers and services, driving the intellectual agenda and building delivery and execution capabilities.

The role is located in Singapore (some flexibility can be exercised in case of exceptional candidates).

Your Qualifications

The ideal candidate would:
Have an MBA or advanced degree in Leadership / Organization topics from a top tier university
Have 3+ years of total experience including 1+ year in a similar role
Strong knowledge of digital tools used in HR and L&D space
Be a strong project manager with clear leadership/ management achievement
Be strong in execution and comfortable with fragmentation
Be actively interested in Leadership and Talent topics; deep experience in the topic areas will be an advantage
Be willing to travel to clients for about 50% of the time based on client needs

RIB Software SE is the global leader of digital transformation for building and construction industries, providing the most cutting edge software technologies and innovative working methods to increase industry productivity. RIB endeavours to be the best partner of building and construction enterprises for digitalization and transformation. Our iTWO solution is an eco-system that helps digitalize enterprises in the building and construction industries. The flagship iTWO 4.0 platform integrates 3D BIM models with project schedule (4th D) and cost (5th D) for design-to-delivery management, realizing end-to-end digital planning and physical construction in one cloud-based integrated platform, creating maximum business value. With offices in over 30 countries, 1000 employees and over 15,000 clients, RIB is regarded as the benchmark for construction technology.

Project Introduction

iTWO 5D Lab is an iTWO technology- enabled environment where customers can visit and experience using iTWO technology with real projects. The lab simulates a real working environment of a company with decision making table and function supporting workstations representing each functional department of a company. The customers can have real experience of using the cutting edge iTWO technology with standard project templates, as well as bring their own project data.

Due to the vigorous development of digital technology and change of working style these days, we are going to set up an Analytic LAB in Singapore to pool the resources together and prepare together since all work could be done remotely and virtual. In this way, we can mobilize the knowledge of our subject matter experts best possible. Thus we are looking for some talented Business Analysts to support global business by checking if tasks are executed as planned and evaluating the status of our developments. The ideal candidates will be part of a dynamic, global team and will play a crucial role in helping achieve the company’s objectives.

Work closely with global business teams and programs to analyze business data, program process and synthesizes analyses into clear, sound recommendations
Create easy-to-consume dashboards of key metrics; monitor and share insights at a frequent cadence
Visualize data to communicate performance and impact of various product changes
Translate broad business goals into testable hypotheses and actionable recommendations
Serve as an internal consultant for the Product, Sales, Marketing, and Customer Support teams for all things data and analytics

MBA or Master degree in Business Management, Mathematics, Finance, Engineering Science, Information Technology, Construction, Business/Data Analytics, Statistics or other related disciplines.
Strong ability in self-motivated and high responsibility for daily work. Proven ability to work in a team environment and multi-task to produce quality client deliverables
Strong analytical skills – has ability to ask right questions, analyze data, draws conclusion by making appropriate assumptions
Excellent presentation, communication and client influencing skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Willing to work a flexible schedule

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

NE Digital is the digital, data and technology organization that serve as a center of excellence to drive digital transformation for our group of NTUC Social Enterprises to meet the critical social needs of Singapore's community. Delivering innovative products and solutions, we empower our people to lead a better and meaningful life through digital services in the area of daily essentials, health and community care, childcare and education as well as financial services.

The Team

We believe that diversity is key to driving an innovative, cohesive, productive and fun workplace! Hence, at NE Digital our people join us from all around the world. Be sure to be soaked in an environment with different ethnic groups driving innovation and injecting some creative juice as one!

Contributing to a social purpose through technology, our team of passionate and dedicated folks are spread into different social enterprises such as NTUC Fairprice Group, NTUC First Campus, NTUC Health and among others!

Creating technologies that impacts!

RESPONSIBILITIES

We are seeking a candidate with a track record in data science and analytics to fill an opening in NTUC Link’s Partnership Analytics team. The Partnership analytics team supports and drives the business growth for 10-15 top key merchants in the Plus! Ecosystem.This position is tasked with executing a mix of data science and business analytics, geared towards i) delivering actionable insights to aid business strategy; ii) developing predictive models to increase customer engagement and personalize communications. You should be proficient in the application of data science on customer transaction and campaign data, and a variety of semi-structured/unstructured data, to produce solutions in areas such as customer segmentation and targeting, lookalike modeling, item recommendation systems, and marketing attribution.

Responsibilities:
Partner with Sales, Marketing and Product business units to understand their priorities on an ongoing basis
Work with business, product and data engineering teams to plan, identify, collect and integrate data from multiple systems
Automate workflows for feature engineering and model updating
Develop machine learning models and perform statistical analysis to solve problems in the following domains: campaign planning, customer segmentation, acquisition and churn prevention, item recommendation, and marketing attribution
Perform A/B testing and other advanced experiments to test your prototypes on marketing campaigns
Communicate with machine learning engineers to support the deployment of your prototypes across the company’s products
Communicate analytical findings and recommendations to senior management and business stakeholders, via a mix of scrum sessions, online dashboards and Powerpoint presentations
Design and architect the entire workflow of the algorithms that includes data inputs, outputs and database storage
Develop scalable algorithms to measure key performance metrics
Build scalable, efficient, and automated data processes to facilitate customer-facing reporting
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor or Masters in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Physics, Economics, Knowledge Engineering, Data Analytics, or a related quantitative field
Familiarity with consumer marketing, and with relevant industry experience in retail,consumer goods, ecommerce, technology, or consumer banking/insurance
Solid understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning and experimental design
Proficiency in R/Python is preferred. SQL or equivalent query languages in tools like Hive is must
Experience interfacing with cloud platforms like AWS Redshift is an advantage
Working knowledge of BI and visualization tools like Tableau/Qlik/Power BI
Team player who is able to build strong partnerships and collaborations with the business
Experience communicating complex data and insight to business audience
Creative problem solving skills, to identify pain points, conceptualize solution while balance complexity and effort in process and technology changes
Hands on experience with development of end-to-end data analytics solutions including data exploration/crawling, model building and performance evaluation

Job Description & Summary

In PwC’s Cybersecurity and Privacy Consulting practice, our work is always evolving to respond to industry trends and management focus, and we combine our deep technical skills in response to our clients' changing needs. Over time, what we do remains closely linked with helping our clients improve the way they operate; innovate and grow; reduce costs; manage risks; leverage talent; and change the way they do business.

Choose a career at PwC’s Cybersecurity and Privacy Consulting and enjoy an innovative environment where challenging and interesting work is part of daily life.

We are looking for Associates for our 2020 intake.

Responsibilities:
Understand security concepts and how they apply to business and technology solutions
Create and cultivate relationships with clients based on capability and credibility
Identify and address client needs, actively participating in client discussions and meetings, managing engagements including preparing concise and accurate documentation
Assess, design and implement appropriate measures, technologies and processes to adequately mitigate risks and provide demonstrable value to the client
Work with product vendors and service providers to understand their offerings and strengths in order to develop pragmatic solutions to solve our client’s business challenges
Employ a quality approach to consulting delivery ensuring complete client satisfaction and project profitability
Conduct research to maintain and expand knowledge on the latest landscape, technologies and standards
Share knowledge with team members and contribute to growth and development of the organization
Requirements:
Final year Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Electrical, Electronic, or other IT-related student from a reputable local university
Related professional certifications preferred, example CISSP, CEH, CCSP, GIAC, CIAM, CIST, CIMP, CISSP, CISA, SABSA, etc.
Strong time management skills, self-directed, with the ability to work both independently and part of a diverse team
Possess knowledge and understanding of risks and its impact to the business and have the ability to articulate the need and value of security solutions to an organization;
Strong analytical, creative problem-solving and negotiation skills, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment;
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including both technical and business writing, documentation and presentation skills, with the ability to present ideas and results to technical and non-technical audiences;
Relevant experience in Cybersecurity, Infrastructure Security, or Data Protection, Identity and Access Management (including any internship) will be will be an advantage
Preference for basic competency in two or more of the following:
Security strategy, risk, and privacy management
Data and application protection, including data classification, data discovery, data governance, DLP, IRM, EDR, tokenization, encryption, blockchain, TDE, cloud, mobility, microservices, APIsec, devsecops, API, back-up/recovery and retention, etc.
Cyber security, including, TVM, APT, IPS, SIEM, DDoS, defacement, SOC operations/automation and testing, metrics, monitoring and reporting, etc.
Security architecture, design, and blueprint is a plus, including experience in Akamai, FireEye, Palo Alto Networks, Splunk, Tanium, CrowdStrike, Titus, Digital Guardian, Symantec, Airwatch, AWS, Azure, SafeNet, Gemalto, etc.
Information security strategy, risk, and privacy management
Identity lifecycle management, including provisioning/de-provisioning, governance certification, directories, etc
Authentication and Access management, including, SSO, 2FA, PKI, biometrics, RBAC, SOD, privileged access, etc.
IAM architecture, design, and blueprint, is a plus, including experience in SailPoint, ForgeRock, CA, Oracle, IBM, Microsoft, RSA, CyberArk, BeyondTrust, etc.

Basic qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering or other related fields
Expert working knowledge on SQL, and R to perform data querying, building data models and conduct data analysis.
Exceptional visualisation skills using Tableau, Qlikview or other relevant visualisation tools.
Exhibit sound business judgment, a proven ability to influence others, strong analytical skills, and a proven track record of taking ownership, leading data-driven analyses, and influencing result

Would you like to be part of a team focused on increasing adoption of the Amazon Web Services (AWS)? AWS is leading a paradigm shift in computing and is looking for world class candidates to lead and manage programs that enable excellence in the fast growing Customer Solution Management (CSM) team across APJ. You will help shape the rapidly growing CSM function, where your passion to define and implement standard processes, methodologies, and tools will be highly valued.

Role & Responsibilities
Amazon has a strong culture of data-driven decision-making; requiring timely, accurate, and actionable intelligence that delivers significant business value. We are looking for a hands-on and motivated self-starter who is passionate about using data to help us measure every area of the business and influence decision-making. In this role, the Business Analyst will play a key role in enabling data driven decision making, serving as a bridge through the business to design and scale ways to communicate complex multi-dimensional data sets in sophisticated way. Being highly strategic, analytical and a problem solver with a keen eye for detail, you will act as a catalyst in providing the CSM organization with in-depth data insight and will take a consultative approach to defining and building upon requirements and products. You will work with a complex stakeholder landscape to turn data into critical insights and knowledge to support data driven decision making.

You will work in virtual teams across APJ and worldwide to assess processes, determine business requirements and deliver data-driven recommendations, reports and dashboards balancing insight with what is technically feasible and pragmatic. Working in an Agile way and iterating frequently, you will leverage your deep understanding of data models, networks, databases and understand how data-driven changes to process, products, services, software and hardware can improve efficiencies and add value.

You will support the continuous evolution of management reporting, conduct complex data analysis and deliver business insights in an environment of rapid growth. You will be experienced at working with large data sets and the technical tools needed to work with them. You will possess excellent communication skills and Agile project management skills, will be customer obsessed and able to communicate complex business insights both verbally and in writing in a clear and precise manner.

Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Defining business requirements and reporting them back to stakeholders
Analyzing the design of technical systems and business models.
Carry out Processes modelling and Data modelling
Sourcing and implementing new business technology
Supporting variance analysis
Finding and supporting the build of technical solutions to business requirements
Producing reports on application development and implementation
Develop or enhance and provision of BI reporting through the deployment of self-service reports and dashboards
Develop or enhance and provision of advanced analysis through the use of classical statistical and machine driven techniques
Maintain thorough knowledge of existing and emerging open source and proprietary BI and advanced analysis tools, implementing new business technology.
Proactively propose enhancements, new features to data models and/or visualization tools to add value and understanding to the business
Troubleshoot challenges around data models, availability of data and visualization tools
Running A/B tests and analyzing data along with running QA checks.
Preferred qualifications
Prior experience working in a technology organization
Experience in implementing AWS/cloud services

Job Title: Tax Technology and Transformation Manager, APTC
Job Description:
Our Tax
Technology and Transformation practice provides a wide range of services around
various tax operational challenges that our clients face with respect to
technology, data, process and people. As part of a global team of tax
professionals in 150 countries, you will get a plenty of opportunities to use
and build upon your experience in strategy and process consulting, data
management, implementation of tax software systems and building tax
requirements for various systems to help our clients improve the performance of
tax functions.

The
opportunity

As a Manager for
Tax Technology and Transformation, you are the trusted advisor with deep
understanding of tools and practices across Tax function with a business-oriented
mindset. You will lead the
tax service delivery projects from an end-to-end perspective that will have
significant impact on our clients’ businesses. You will
advise our clients on the strategic and operational challenges facing their tax
functions and to deliver technology enabled transformation.

Your key responsibilities
Define project objectives and scope utilizing expert knowledge of project management practices and procedures
Responsible for the Project Management Plan, which includes areas such as a business case, work plan, schedule, budget, resource plan, communication plan, change plan, and risk plan
Translate key implications from business strategy into execution and act as strategic partner of business
Process and Controls Enhancement: Re-design and deploy streamlined tax processes including new technology solutions with clear roles and responsibilities, standardized work processes, proper controls embedded to manage risks
Data and Systems Effectiveness: Embed the needs of Tax into Finance and IT systems to increase automation and data quality throughout tax processes; automate tax processing, tax compliance and reporting through various tax technologies
Risk Management: Assess and prioritize tax risks to establish a proper control environment that takes if into account the various regulatory regimes
Skills and attributes for success
To be an empowered partner who will drive results, proactively identify and resolve problems, and make tough decisions
Ability to keep up with project management technology, trends and best practices
A keen interest and experience in improving the performance of tax functions
Demonstrated ability to team with and motivate others
Willingness to develop meaningful and influential relationships with clients and colleagues
Strong leadership, attention to detail, problem-solving skills and analytical abilities
To qualify for the role you must have
A degree in relevant field
5-10 years of relevant work experience in project management roles
Proactive personality
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Flexibility to travel occasionally around Asia Pacific regions
Ideally, you'll also have
Good knowledge of how accounting systems (e.g. SAP, Hyperion, etc) are set-up and used to generate data and compliance
Understanding of databases
Experience in development with SharePoint
A background in tax or finance
Verbal and written communication skills in Mandarin
Experience working in public accounting firms and accreditation by SIATP
What we look for

Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.
What working at EY offers

EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:
Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
Join us in building a better working world.
Apply today.

Duties and Responsibilities

To fulfill this role, the Consultant, Professional Security Services will:

Lead the client engagements for projects assigned either as an individual or as a member of a larger consulting team.
Be responsible for managing the project delivery, maintaining complete control on project schedule, budget and risk issues; facilitates timely decisions and make necessary escalations to maintain project schedule and budget; identify project risks early and assist by providing prudent and timely recommendations for risk avoidance; sets and manages client expectations; creates and executes project work plans and revises as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements; communicates effectively with clients and internal stakeholders to identify needs; continually seeks opportunities to increase customer satisfaction. This includes:
Determining and providing advice on the most effective ways to protect computers, networks, software, data and information systems against possible cyber attacks
Interviewing customer-end stakeholders to determine specific security issues
Performing application, systems and network vulnerability testing, risk analyses and security assessments including penetration testing
Planning, researching and designing robust security architectures for assigned projects
Familiarization and expert use of industry security testing tools
Preparing and delivering clear and concise technical & management reports and formal papers (when necessary) on test findings to the different levels of customer-end stakeholders including the management This includes making appropriate level presentations to the customer’s stakeholders
Providing guidance and advisory on the findings to customer stakeholders including developers to remediate the findings
Researching and keeping up-to-date on security trends, security standards and security best practices
Keeping up-to-date with technological trends in relation to cyber security
Performing other job-related duties as assigned
Be responsible for providing technical supervision for (and guidance to) to juniors in the security team i.e. Associate Consultants. Guiding, training and coaching the Associate Consultants to develop and enhance the performance and skills of team members; participates in the training of new consultants; creates and maintains project budget, assists with implementation plans and modifying when necessary to include agreed revisions to project scope; drives results in alignment with business objectives; leads/facilitates internal meetings as well as client meetings in support of project delivery
Responsibilities include supporting pre-sales processes and working with sales and account management professionals to win new business; implementing business; proposal review and refinement;
Maintaining accurate records of “Work in Progress (WIP)” reporting for work delivered with timely clocking in Workday system
Providing Project Plans and regular project status updates to Senior Consultant | Lead Consultant | Project Manager | Operations Manager

Requirements

Diploma/ Bachelor’s Degree in a related field or equivalent experience is preferred
Relevant Industry Certifications such as CISSP, CREST, OSCP, CEH or equivalent is a must
For the position of Consultant I , at least 3 years of IT Security experience preferably in a Professional Security Service environment; For the position of Senior Consultant , at least 5 years of IT Security experience preferably in a Professional Security Service environment;

Preferred Skills /Qualities

Good project management, consulting, customer service, technology skills
Good communication, presentation, writing and negotiation skills
Team player who can perform under pressure and tight deadlines
Familiarity with client server technologies, Virtualization, Cloud and strong knowledge of TCP/IP networks
Programming and Shell scripting knowledge will be an advantageous

Job Description:

Description du poste & résumé

In PwC’s Cybersecurity and Privacy Consulting practice, our work is always evolving to respond to industry trends and management focus, and we combine our deep technical skills in response to our clients' changing needs. Over time, what we do remains closely linked with helping our clients improve the way they operate; innovate and grow; reduce costs; manage risks; leverage talent; and change the way they do business.

Choose a career at PwC’s Cybersecurity and Privacy Consulting and enjoy an innovative environment where challenging and interesting work is part of daily life.

We are looking for Associates for our 2020 intake.

Responsibilities:
Understand security concepts and how they apply to business and technology solutions
Create and cultivate relationships with clients based on capability and credibility
Identify and address client needs, actively participating in client discussions and meetings, managing engagements including preparing concise and accurate documentation
Assess, design and implement appropriate measures, technologies and processes to adequately mitigate risks and provide demonstrable value to the client
Work with product vendors and service providers to understand their offerings and strengths in order to develop pragmatic solutions to solve our client’s business challenges
Employ a quality approach to consulting delivery ensuring complete client satisfaction and project profitability
Conduct research to maintain and expand knowledge on the latest landscape, technologies and standards
Share knowledge with team members and contribute to growth and development of the organization
Requirements:
Final year Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Electrical, Electronic, or other IT-related student from a reputable local university
Related professional certifications preferred, example CISSP, CEH, CCSP, GIAC, CIAM, CIST, CIMP, CISSP, CISA, SABSA, etc.
Strong time management skills, self-directed, with the ability to work both independently and part of a diverse team
Possess knowledge and understanding of risks and its impact to the business and have the ability to articulate the need and value of security solutions to an organization;
Strong analytical, creative problem-solving and negotiation skills, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment;
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including both technical and business writing, documentation and presentation skills, with the ability to present ideas and results to technical and non-technical audiences;
Relevant experience in Cybersecurity, Infrastructure Security, or Data Protection, Identity and Access Management (including any internship) will be will be an advantage
Preference for basic competency in two or more of the following:
Security strategy, risk, and privacy management
Data and application protection, including data classification, data discovery, data governance, DLP, IRM, EDR, tokenization, encryption, blockchain, TDE, cloud, mobility, microservices, APIsec, devsecops, API, back-up/recovery and retention, etc.
Cyber security, including, TVM, APT, IPS, SIEM, DDoS, defacement, SOC operations/automation and testing, metrics, monitoring and reporting, etc.
Security architecture, design, and blueprint is a plus, including experience in Akamai, FireEye, Palo Alto Networks, Splunk, Tanium, CrowdStrike, Titus, Digital Guardian, Symantec, Airwatch, AWS, Azure, SafeNet, Gemalto, etc.
Information security strategy, risk, and privacy management
Identity lifecycle management, including provisioning/de-provisioning, governance certification, directories, etc
Authentication and Access management, including, SSO, 2FA, PKI, biometrics, RBAC, SOD, privileged access, etc.
IAM architecture, design, and blueprint, is a plus, including experience in SailPoint, ForgeRock, CA, Oracle, IBM, Microsoft, RSA, CyberArk, BeyondTrust, etc.
